verses.verse: Hear<WH8085> you now what the Lord<WH3068> says<WH559>; Arise<WH6965>, contend<WH7378> you before the mountains<WH2022>, and let the hills<WH1389> hear<WH8085> your voice<WH6963>.

Hear<WH8085> you<WH2022>, O mountains, the Lord<WH3068>'s controversy<WH7379>, and you strong<WH386> foundations<WH4146> of the earth<WH776>: for the Lord<WH3068> has a controversy<WH7379> with his people<WH5971>, and he will plead<WH3198> with Israel<WH3478>.
O my people<WH5971>, what have I done<WH6213> unto you<WH3811>? and where have I wearied you<WH6030>? testify against me.

For I brought you up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and redeemed<WH6299> you out of the house<WH1004> of servants<WH5650>; and I sent<WH7971> before<WH6440> you Moses<WH4872>, Aaron<WH175>, and Miriam<WH4813>.

O my people<WH5971>, remember<WH2142> now what Balak<WH1111> king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> consulted<WH3289>, and what Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> answered<WH6030> him from Acacia<WH7851> unto Gilgal<WH1537>; that you may know<WH3045> the righteousness<WH6666> of the Lord<WH3068>.

With Which shall I come before<WH6923> the Lord<WH3068>, and bow<WH3721> myself before the high<WH4791> God<WH430>? shall I come before<WH6923> him with burnt offerings<WH5930>, with calves<WH5695> of a year<WH8141> old<WH1121>?

Will the Lord<WH3068> be pleased<WH7521> with thousands<WH505> of rams<WH352>, or with ten thousands<WH7233> of rivers<WH5158> of oil<WH8081>? shall I give<WH5414> my firstborn<WH1060> for my transgression<WH6588>, the fruit<WH6529> of my body<WH990> for the sin<WH2403> of my soul<WH5315>?

He has showed<WH5046> you<WH120>, O man, what is good<WH2896>; and what does the Lord<WH3068> require<WH1875> of you<WH6213>, but to do justly<WH4941>, and to love<WH160> mercy<WH2617>, and to walk<WH3212> humbly<WH6800> with your God<WH430>?

The Lord<WH3068>'s voice<WH6963> cries<WH7121> unto the city<WH5892>, and the man of wisdom<WH8454> shall see<WH7200> your name<WH8034>: hear<WH8085> you the rod<WH4294>, and who has appointed it<WH3259>.
Are there<WH786> yet the treasures<WH214> of wickedness<WH7562> in the house<WH1004> of the wicked<WH7563>, and the scant<WH7332> measure<WH374> that is abominable<WH2194>?
Shall I count them pure<WH2135> with the wicked<WH7562> balances<WH3976>, and with the bag<WH3599> of deceitful<WH4820> weights<WH68>?

For the rich men<WH6223> there are full<WH4390> of violence<WH2555>, and the inhabitants<WH3427> there have spoken<WH1696> lies<WH8267>, and their tongue<WH3956> is deceitful<WH7423> in their mouth<WH6310>.
Therefore also will I make you sick<WH2470> in striking<WH5221> you<WH8074>, in making you desolate because of your sins<WH2403>.

You shall eat<WH398>, but not be satisfied<WH7646>; and your casting down<WH3445> shall be in the midst<WH7130> of you<WH5253>; and you shall take hold, but shall not deliver<WH6403>; and that which you deliver<WH6403> will I give up<WH5414> to the sword<WH2719>.

You shall sow<WH2232>, but you shall not reap<WH7114>; you shall tread<WH1869> the olives<WH2132>, but you shall not anoint<WH5480> you with oil<WH8081>; and sweet wine<WH8492>, but shall not drink<WH8354> wine<WH3196>.

For the statutes<WH2708> of Omri<WH6018> are kept<WH8104>, and all the works<WH4639> of the house<WH1004> of Ahab<WH256>, and you walk<WH3212> in their counsels<WH4156>; that I should make<WH5414> you a desolation<WH8047>, and the inhabitants<WH3427> there a hissing<WH8322>: therefore you shall bear<WH5375> the reproach<WH2781> of my people<WH5971>.
